name: material
title: Material
description: An entity that can be identified, exist for some period of time, and consist in whole or in part of physical matter while it exists.

fields.name: materialEntityID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Values of dwc:materialEntityID are intended to uniquely and persistently identify a particular dwc:MaterialEntity within some context. Examples of context include a particular sample collection, an organization, or the worldwide scale. Recommended best practice is to use a persistent, globally unique identifier. The identifier is bound to a physical object (a dwc:MaterialEntity) as opposed to a particular digital record (representation) of that physical object.

fields.name: eventID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: materialEntityType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.
fields.examples: `whole organism`; `heart`; `liver tissue sample`; `fossil`; `germplasm`; `skull`; `cast`; `3D printed model`; `printed photograph`

fields.name: materialEntityTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the type of dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary..

fields.name: materialEntityTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for materialEntityType are given.

fields.name: institutionCode
fields.description: A name (or acronym) in use by an institution.

fields.name: institutionID
fields.description: An identifier for an institution (Agent).
fields.comments: For physical specimens, the recommended best practice is to use a globally unique and resolvable identifier from a collections registry such as the Research Organization Registry (ROR) or the GBIF Registry of Scientific Collections (https://www.gbif.org/grscicoll).

fields.name: ownerInstitutionCode
fields.description: A name (or acronym) in use by the institution having ownership of a dwc:MaterialEntity.

fields.name: ownerInstitutionID
fields.description: An identifier for an institution (Agent) that owns a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: For physical specimens, the recommended best practice is to use a globally unique and resolvable identifier from a collections registry such as the Research Organization Registry (ROR) or the GBIF Registry of Scientific Collections (https://www.gbif.org/grscicoll).

fields.name: collectionCode
fields.description: A name, acronym, coden, or initialism identifying a Collection.

fields.name: collectionID
fields.description: An identifier for a Collection.
fields.comments: For physical specimens, the recommended best practice is to use a globally unique and resolvable identifier from a collections registry such as the GBIF Registry of Scientific Collections (https://www.gbif.org/grscicoll).

fields.name: catalogNumber
fields.description: An identifier (preferably unique) for a dwc:MaterialEntity within a Collection.

fields.name: otherCatalogNumbers
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of previous or alternate fully qualified catalog numbers or other human-used identifiers for the same dwc:MaterialEntity, whether in the current or any other data set or collection.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: recordNumber
fields.description: An identifier given to a dwc:MaterialEntity at the time it was recorded. Often serves as a link between field notes and a dwc:MaterialEntity record, such as a specimen collector's number.

fields.name: preparations
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of preparations and preservation methods for a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: disposition
fields.description: The current state of a dwc:MaterialEntity with respect to where it can be found.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: verbatimLabel
fields.description: The content of this term should include no embellishments, prefixes, headers or other additions made to the text. Abbreviations must not be expanded and supposed misspellings must not be corrected. Lines or breakpoints between blocks of text that could be verified by seeing the original labels or images of them may be used. Examples of material entities include preserved specimens, fossil specimens, and material samples. Best practice is to use UTF-8 for all characters. Best practice is to add comment “verbatimLabel derived from human transcription” in dwc:occurrenceRemarks.
fields.comments: Examples can be found at https://dwc.tdwg.org/examples/verbatimLabel.

fields.name: associatedSequences
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of genetic sequence information associated with a dwc:MaterialEntity.

fields.name: materialCitation
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).
fields.examples: `Christopher J. Conroy, Jennifer L. Neuwald. 2008. Phylogeographic study of the California vole, Microtus californicus Journal of Mammalogy, 89(3):755-767.`; `Steven R. Hoofer and Ronald A. Van Den Bussche. 2001. Phylogenetic Relationships of Plecotine Bats and Allies Based on Mitochondrial Ribosomal Sequences. Journal of Mammalogy 82(1):131-137. | Walker, Faith M., Jeffrey T. Foster, Kevin P. Drees, Carol L. Chambers. 2014. Spotted bat (Euderma maculatum) microsatellite discovery using illumina sequencing. Conservation Genetics Resources.`

fields.name: materialEntityRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.examples: `found in association with charred remains`; `some original fragments missing`

fields.name: evidenceForOccurrenceID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Occurrence for which a dwc:MaterialEntity provides evidence.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: derivedFromMaterialEntityID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity from which this dwc:MaterialEntity was derived.

fields.name: derivationEventID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Event during which a dwc:MaterialEntity was derived from another dwc:MaterialEntity.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: derivationType
fields.description: The category that best matches the nature of the derivation of a dwc:MaterialEntity from a dwc:MaterialEntity pointed to by derivedFromMaterialEntityID.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: derivationTypeIRI
fields.description: The IRI of the controlled vocabulary value for the type of derivation.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use an IRI for a term in a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: derivationTypeVocabulary
fields.description: The reference to the controlled vocabulary where the definitions of values for derivationType are given.

fields.name: partOfMaterialEntityID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity that this dwc:MaterialEntity is part of.

fields.name: identifiedBy
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned the dwc:Taxon to the subject.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: identifiedByID
fields.description: The identifier for the Agent that asserted the dwc:Identification.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to provide a single identifier that disambiguates the details of the identifying agent. If a list is used, the order of the identifiers on the list should not be assumed to convey any semantics. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: dateIdentified
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of people, groups, or organizations who assigned a dwc:Taxon to the subject.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.

fields.name: taxonID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Taxon.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: kingdom
fields.description: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which the dwc:scientificName is classified.

fields.name: scientificName
fields.description: The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of a dc:Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the dwc:verbatimIdentification term.

fields.name: taxonRank
fields.description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in a dwc:scientificName.

fields.name: taxonRemarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a dwc:Taxon.
fields.examples: `this name is a misspelling in common use`
